law.catch_line: Right to perpetuate evidence concerning land.
law.text: Persons who own any real property or any interest therein or appurtenances thereto, may by deposition perpetuate the testimony of any and all living witnesses relative to their title in the manner provided in KRS 422.170 to 422.190.
law.history: Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 1649a-1.
